meanings.definition: Have the courage to do something.
meanings.sent1: I dare to jump over the small puddle.
meanings.sent2: She dared to speak up in class.
meanings.sent3: Do you dare to try the spicy salsa?
meanings.sent4: Taking the dare to climb the tree, he conquered his fear of heights.
meanings.sent5: With a deep breath, she dared to ask for help.

meanings.definition: Defy or challenge someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: He dared his friend to eat the whole chili pepper.
meanings.sent2: She dared him to run around the block in under a minute.
meanings.sent3: The siblings dared each other to see who could hold their breath the longest.
meanings.sent4: The coach dared the team to push themselves harder in practice.
meanings.sent5: The students dared each other to see who could solve the math problem first.

meanings.definition: A challenge or provocation to do something.
meanings.sent1: The dare to climb the highest peak excited the adventurers.
meanings.sent2: She accepted the dare to perform a daring stunt on her skateboard.
meanings.sent3: The dare to eat the super spicy wings made him sweat.
meanings.sent4: His decision to take the dare and skydive was met with cheers.
meanings.sent5: The dare to swim across the lake seemed daunting but thrilling.
